actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-540.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 188.
Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2412.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Considered as unfinished business.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 417 - 0 (Roll no. 76).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Smith, of NH without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 505.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 106-203.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation

official_title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 South Harrison Street in Fort Wayne, Indiana, as the "E. Ross Adair Federal Building and United States Courthouse".

summary.text: Designates the Federal building and U.S. courthouse located at 1300 South Harrison Street in Fort Wayne, Indiana, as the E. Ross Adair Federal Building and United States Courthouse.

titles.title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 South Harrison Street in Fort Wayne, Indiana, as the "E. Ross Adair Federal Building and United States Courthouse".
